Ralcorp Holdings Inc. - Ogden, UT facility is located at 215 North 700 West in Ogden, UT.  The facility consists of a processing plant used for manufacturing, storage, and freezing of bakery products.  The facility maintains approximately 800 full time employees.



Protecting the health and safety of our employees, neighbors, and the surrounding environment is our top priority.  One component of these efforts is the risk management program (RMP) that helps manage the risks involved with using hazardous substances at our facility and that complies with the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR Part 68.



1.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Action (?68.155(a) and ?68.155(d)):



Protecting the health and safety of our employees and neighbors, and of the surrounding environment, is our top priority, and we have a comprehensive program in place to reduce risks associated with our process.



Hazard Assessment and Reduction - We regularly assess the risks associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia in our manufacturing processes and seek out ways in which to reduce those risks.



Accident Prevention - We engineer and construct our manufacturing processes and equipment to minimize the possibility of accidental chemical releases.  We also provide our employees with extensive training in the safe operation of those processes and equipment.



Emergency Action - We have developed an OSHA hazardous substance Emergency Action Plan.  This plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations, incident alarms and alerting.  Depending upon a given situation, the Ogden Fire Department will be called to provide emergency responders and equipment.  The Ogden Fire Department will be called for all fire related emergencies.  The facility has communicated the hazard of anhydrous ammonia with the Ogden Fire Department and the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  The incident commander has ultimate control of the implementation

of the emergency response.



Our internal emergency communications program ensures that all supervisors and employees in areas affected by an inadvertent chemical leak are warned and evacuated, if necessary, and immediate steps are taken to evaluate and stop the leak.



2.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substances (?68.155(b)):



Ralcorp Holdings Inc. - Ogden, UT is a processing plant located at 215 North 700 West in Ogden, UT.  The facility utilizes anhydrous ammonia for refrigeration and freezing of the bakery products manufactured and stored at the facility.



3.  Worst Case and Alternative Release Scenarios (?68.155(c)):



RMP*Comp was utilized to calculate the worst case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process.



4. Five-Year Accident History (?68.155(e)):



There have been no reportable incidents during the past five years.  However, the facility maintains records of all incident investigation reports regardless of the amount of anhydrous ammonia released into the atmosphere.



5. Emergency Action Plan and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps (?68.155(f)):



We have developed and implemented an OSHA hazardous substance emergency action plan for anhydrous ammonia.  The plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations, incident alarms and alerting.  The emergency action plan includes procedures for:



a) Informing the National Response Center (NRC), LEPC, Fire Department, Police, etc. About accidental releases that could reasonably result in offsite consequences.



B) Providing proper first aid and emergency medical treatment for accidental human exposure to anhydrous ammonia.



We have an Emergency Action Program that identifies the actions to be taken during an emergency situation, and the Plant Manager is in charge of coordinating emergency actions.  All of our personnel are trained in evacuation procedures.  The EHS Manager is responsible for apprising the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) of the emergenc

y situation, and the LEPC is responsible for notifying the public, if necessary.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety (?68.155(g)):



We constantly strive to improve the safety of our processes using recommendations developed through the prevention program and a program soliciting safety suggestions from our employees.  Based on the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for anhydrous ammonia, a list of action items was developed.  The status of these action items will be monitored to ensure that implementation of the safety improvements is accomplished.  Monthly safety training is conducted for all team 

members at this facility, in addition PSM meetings are held to review safety and PSM program elements.



Update: During March of 2018,  the site added another freezer system.  The new system has an anhydrous ammonia  refrigerant capacity of 8,000 lbs. and is independent from the site's existing freezer with no interconnections in the piping systems.  In addition, the new system has a separate machinery room in its design.  Although the new system is technically below the 10,000 lbs. TQs of PSM and RMP, similar safety protocols established for the existing system have been applied to the new system.  This includes but is not limited to, Process Safety Information, Process Hazards Analysis, Management of Change, Incident Investigation, Mechanical Integrity and Emergency Planning & Response.
